isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSPECT

svcproc.title: GEARS
svcproc.para: Inspect gear teeth for frosting, pitting, spalling, or other damage. Gears with frosting can usually be re-used. Often, frosting on gears heals with continuous use of the transmission and more serious pitting does not occur. Gears with light pitting can have considerable life left and can also be re-used. For gears with severe pitting, spalling, damage, or confirmed noise issues, the complete gear set (mainshaft gear and both countershaft gears) must be replaced.
Inspect the internal clutching teeth for excessive wear or rounding. Replace the gear and sliding clutch if necessary.
